snippet: The pledge, on the heels of an announcement that the United States and China will commit to curbing greenhouse gas emissions, is expected at the Group of 20 summit meeting this weekend.
abstract: President Obama, attending Group of 20 summit meeting in Brisbane, Australia, pledges $3 billion to new international fund to help world's poorest countries handle effects of climate change; announcement is on heels of joint commitment with China earlier in week to curb greenhouse gases over next decade.

byline.original: By CORAL DAVENPORT and MARK LANDLER
byline.contributor: Coral Davenport reported from Washington, and Mark Landler from Yangon, Myanmar.

lead_paragraph: The pledge, on the heels of an announcement that the United States and China will commit to curbing greenhouse gas emissions, is expected at the Group of 20 summit meeting this weekend.

headline.main: U.S. to Give $3 Billion to Climate Fund to Help Poor Nations, and Spur Rich Ones
headline.print_headline: U.S. to Give $3 Billion to Climate Fund to Help Poor Nations, and Spur Rich Ones
